docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Tuesday, Jan. 20 -- The Government mobilized municipal transport workers early today in a general strike that had been supported by about 75 per cent of Argentina's organized labor. Hundreds of Peronist and Communist leaders of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Tuesday, Jan. 20 -- The Government mobilized municipal transport workers early today in a general strike that had been supported by about 75 per cent of Argentina's organized labor. Hundreds of Peronist and Communist leaders of the strike have been arrested.
docs.abstract: Govt mobilizes transport workers as gen strike grows

headline.main: ARGENTINE STRIKE CRIPPLES NATION; 75% of Union Labor Joins General Walkout -- Frondizi Begins 12-Day U. S. Visit

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Jan. 25 -- Communist leaders from various parts of the world are gathering in Moscow for the second time in fourteen months to assess the Communist movement's international standing and to hail Soviet successes and plans for the future.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Jan. 25 -- Communist leaders from various parts of the world are gathering in Moscow for the second time in fourteen months to assess the Communist movement's international standing and to hail Soviet successes and plans for the future.
docs.abstract: speculation on cong; J Jackson, M Shield reptdly represent US Communist party; party identifies Jackson, disclaims knowing Shield

headline.main: KEY REDS GATHER FOR GLOBAL TALKS; Moscow Parley May Mark Turning Point in World Communist Movement

docs.snippet: Two wool-processing groups accused the Treasury Department yesterday of "unseemly haste" in its move to end anti-subsidy duties imposed on Uruguayan wool tops since June, 1953. The term "tops" means wool that has been scoured, carded and combed...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two wool-processing groups accused the Treasury Department yesterday of "unseemly haste" in its move to end anti-subsidy duties imposed on Uruguayan wool tops since June, 1953. The term "tops" means wool that has been scoured, carded and combed preparatory to spinning.
docs.abstract: Wool Mfrs Assn chmn Darman and A Wellman accuse US of haste in ending anti-subsidy duties imposed on Uruguayan wool tops

headline.main: WOOL GROUPS SCORE ACTION ON URUGUAY

docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, Jan. 31 (AP) -- Juan D. Peron, former Argentine dictator, checked out of his hotel here a week ago and his whereabouts is unknown.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 31 -- The International Amateur Basketball Federation today decreed stiff punishment for the Soviet Union quintet that refused on political grounds to play Nationalist China in the third world championship that ends tonight.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 -- The Treasury Department has postponed the lifting of the countervailing penalty on Uraguayan wool top imports, pending a Senate committee hearing.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 -- The Treasury Department has postponed the lifting of the countervailing penalty on Uraguayan wool top imports, pending a Senate committee hearing.
docs.abstract: US delays lifting countervailing duty on Uruguayan wool tops pending Sen com hearing

headline.main: PENALTY IS KEPT ON URUGUAY WOOL; Treasury Delays Rescinding Retaliatory Duty on Tops, Pending Senate Inquiry

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The pressure of Soviet oil exports on the markets of the free world is increasing steadily. With this movement now approaching 300,000 barrels a day oil has become a main weapon of the Russians in the economic penetration of many nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: The pressure of Soviet oil exports on the markets of the free world is increasing steadily. With this movement now approaching 300,000 barrels a day oil has become a main weapon of the Russians in the economic penetration of many nations.

headline.main: RED OIL SQUEEZES WORLD MARKETS; Soviets Exporting 300,000 Barrels a Day -- Tanker Fleet Is Being Built

docs.snippet: THE idea of writing a history of Latin America has tempted many an American university professor despite the risks involved in dealing with twenty republics having such a complex and anarchic background as those south of the Rio Grande.
